TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit PageParser extends System.Web.UI.TemplateControlParser

Docs.summary: Implements a parser for .aspx files. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Remarks ASP.NET uses this class to parse .aspx pages.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor sets default values to be used during page parsing.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Type DefaultApplicationBaseType { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the type from which the instance is derived.
Docs.value: The type from which the instance is derived.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property should be accessed in the Global.asax file before the `PreApplicationStart` event occurs.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Type DefaultPageBaseType { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the type from which all pages are derived.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property can only be set before the `PreApplicationStart` event occurs in the Global.asax file. This property can be read at any time.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Type DefaultPageParserFilterType { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the page parser filter type that should be used at parse time.
Docs.value: The type of the page parser filter.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property should be accessed before the `PreApplicationStart` event occurs in the Global.asax file.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Type DefaultUserControlBaseType { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the type from which all user controls are derived.
Docs.value: The type from which user controls are derived.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property should be accessed before the `PreApplicationStart` event occurs in the Global.asax file.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool EnableLongStringsAsResources { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether ASP.NET should optimize its internal handling of long strings that are encountered when ASP.NET parses a page or control.
Docs.value: if ASP.NET should optimize its internal handling of long strings; otherwise .

remarks.format: ## Remarks By default, the ASP.NET page parser converts literal strings that contain 256 or more characters into a temporary resource string. This property can be set to `false` in order to disable this behavior and instead to write the literal string directly to the response stream. This property can only be set in the Global.asax file before the `PreApplicationStart` event occurs. This property can be read at any time.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Web.IHttpHandler GetCompiledPageInstance (string virtualPath, string inputFile, System.Web.HttpContext context);
.method public static hidebysig class System.Web.IHttpHandler GetCompiledPageInstance(string virtualPath, string inputFile, class System.Web.HttpContext context) cil managed

Docs.param: The virtual path of the requested file.
The physical path of the page.
An object that contains information about the current Web request.
Docs.summary: Returns an instance of a compiled page for the specific virtual path.
Docs.returns: Returns the compiled instance of the requested page.
